name: African American and Diaspora Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of African American and Diaspora Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt African American and Diaspora Studies Department"]
description: department focused on interdisciplinary, cross-cultural, and comparative study of the lived experiences of Blacks dispersed throughout the world from the continent of Africa.

name: American Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt American Studies Department", "Vanderbilt Department of American Studies"]
description: interdisciplinary program fostering the in-depth study of American cultures from a variety of perspectives

name: Anthropology
description: department focused on a broadly-based study of humankind that draws its methods from both the sciences and humanities and includes the fields of cultural anthropology, archaeology, biological anthropology, and linguistics

name: Art
description: department presenting a curriculum that embraces a wide range of art methods and perspectives

name: Asian Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt Asian Studies Department","Vanderbilt Department of Asian Studies"]
description: center for the study of Asian languages and cultures

name: Chemistry
description: department with a particular emphasis on chemical biology, structural biology, molecular toxicology, materials chemistry, and nanotechnology

name: Cinema and Media Arts
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Cinema and Media Arts
description: department focused on filmmaking with the study of media theory and global film history

name: Classical and Mediterranean Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Classical and Mediterranean Studies
description: department offering an interdisciplinary perspective on the culture and history of the Mediterranean world

name: Communication of Science and Technology
labelEn: Vanderbilt Communication of Science and Technology Program
alias: ["Vanderbilt Communication of Science and Technology Department", "Vanderbilt Department of Communication of Science and Technology"]
description: interdisciplinary program focused on communicating science to the public

name: Communication Studies
description: department focused on the rhetorical tradition, communication skills, and investigation of classical means of persuasion, argumentation and debate

name: Earth and Environmental Sciences
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences
description: department focused on understanding Earth's dynamic history and how geological processes affect modern environmental and ecological systems

name: Economics
description: department that provides rigorous training in micro and macroeconomics

name: English
description: department studying English

name: European Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Max Kade Center for European Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt European Studies Department","Vanderbilt Department of European Studies"]
description: department focused on the study of European affairs

name: French and Italian
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of French and Italian
description: department focused on study of French and Italian language, history, civilization, film, business, and literature

name: German, Russian and East European Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of German, Russian and East European Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt German, Russian and East European Studies Department"]
description: department for the study of German, Russian, and East European histories, cultures, arts, and intellectual traditions

name: History
description: department focused on a range of historical questions and methodologies

name: History of Art
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of History of Art
description: department focused on the major fields in world art, from ancient through modern

name: Jewish Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt Jewish Studies Department", "Vanderbilt Department of Jewish Studies"]
description: an interdisciplinary academic program that facilitates the critical study of Jewish history, religion, language, philosophy, politics, culture, society, music, art, and literature

name: Latino and Latina Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Latino and Latina Studies
description: a multidisciplinary program that considers the presence of Latinas/os and Hispanics as an integral part of US culture and history

name: Mathematics
description: department for the study of mathematics

name: Neuroscience
labelEn: Interdisciplinary Program in Neuroscience for Undergraduates at Vanderbilt
description: program for the study of the nervous system

name: Philosophy
description: department studying the major areas of philosophical inquiry

name: Physics and Astronomy
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Physics and Astronomy

name: Political Science
description: department spanning American politics, comparative politics, international relations, political theory, and political methodology

name: Psychology
description: department spanning all sub-disciplines of psychology

name: Public Policy Studies
alias: ["Vanderbilt Public Policy Studies Department", "Vanderbilt Department of Public Policy Studies"]
description: program focused on political science, economics, sociology, anthropology, philosophy, statistics, and public finance

name: Religious Studies
description: department focused on study of the nature, history, and function of different religious traditions

name: Sociology
description: department focused on sociology

name: Spanish and Portuguese
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Spanish and Portuguese
description: department focused on language, literature, linguistics, and culture of Spanish and Portuguese with courses in Catalan

name: Theatre
description: department focused on theatrical production and theatre studies

name: Women's and Gender Studies
labelEn: Vanderbilt Department of Women's and Gender Studies
description: program focused on recognizing that gender, race, class, ethnicity, age, sexuality, and nationality are crucial aspects of identity
